title.narrative: Opportunities and Challenges for Telecommunications and Internet Governance in the Americas
Possibilités et défis associés à la gouvernance des télécommunications et d'Internet dans les Amériques

description.narrative:
This project will support strategic multilateral and multi-stakeholder dialogues on telecommunication regulation and Internet governance in the Americas. Project funds will serve to share the Institute for Connectivity in the Americas' knowledge, evidence, expertise, and research results.
Specifically, the project will allow Hernán Galperin, a leading researcher in the Regional Dialogue on the Information Society, to participate in two major regional events, including: -the World Telecommunication Development Conference 2014 Regional Preparatory Meeting for the Americas in Montevideo, Uruguay (this will be preceded by the Regional Development Forum for the Americas); and, -the Latin American Preparatory Meeting for the Internet Governance Forum in Cordoba, Argentina.
The project team will prepare a package of research results published in the book, Broadband in Latin America: beyond connectivity to be distributed at both events.
Together with Industry Canada, IDRC partners will explore opportunities to address current needs. These include: -rolling out broadband infrastructure; -developing applications and local content; -ensuring international internet connectivity; -supporting regulatory environments that promote competition, investment, and innovation; and, -strengthening the role of governments in the current multi-stakeholder Internet governance model.
